dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game.java - master class that list the entire game and contain all the components of the game
    Author:
    Rui Guedes and César Pinho
    See Also:
    Door, Drunken, Elements, GameMap, Guard, Hero, Lock, Ogre, Rookie, Suspicious

      Game(GameMap gameMap, java.lang.String guardType, int ogresNumber)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkGameStatus()
      Check the position of the hero and if he is captured or killed by a guard, if it is the first level, or a ogre, if it is the second level.
      Elements findClubPosition(Elements position, char[][] tmpMap)
      Find the position around the ogre where is the club.
      void initDoors(Elements position, char[][] tmpMap)
      Create a new door take in account if it is in the map extremes (exit door) or not (normal door).
      void initElements(java.lang.String guardType, int ogresNumber)
      Initialize the stable and unstable pieces calling the functions initStableElements and initUnstableElements.
      void initGuard(Elements position, java.lang.String guardType)
      Create a new guard take in account the type of guard.
      void initLock(Elements position)
      Create a new lock of the lever type if is the level 1 or the key type otherwise
      void initOgres(Elements position, int ogresNumber)
      Call the findClubPosition to find the club and create a ogresNumber of new ogres.
      void initStableElements(Elements position, char[][] tmpMap)
      Initialize the lock and door type elements calling the functions initLock and initDoor.
      void initUnstableElements(Elements position, java.lang.String guardType, int ogresNumber)
      Initialize the hero and the guard and ogre type elements calling the functions initGuard and initOgre.
      char[][] updateMap(char[][] tmpMap)
      Receive a game map and changes it according to the changes previously made to the components of the game, for example, when the doors is unlocked is need change the mark that echoes the door in the map.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GameMap gameMap,
            java.lang.String guardType,
            int ogresNumber)
        Class constructor specifying the game map, guard type and the number of ogres. Initialize the gameState and map attributes and call the initElements method to initializer the other attributes.
        Parameters:
        gameMap - map of the game
        guardType - initial guard type of the first level
        ogresNumber - number of ogres of the second level

    • Method Detail

      • initElements

        public void initElements(java.lang.String guardType,
                         int ogresNumber)
        Initialize the stable and unstable pieces calling the functions initStableElements and initUnstableElements.
        Parameters:
        guardType - guard type that needs to be create
        ogresNumber - number of ogres that needs to be create

      • initStableElements

        public void initStableElements(Elements position,
                               char[][] tmpMap)
        Initialize the lock and door type elements calling the functions initLock and initDoor.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element
        tmpMap - game map

      • initUnstableElements

        public void initUnstableElements(Elements position,
                                 java.lang.String guardType,
                                 int ogresNumber)
        Initialize the hero and the guard and ogre type elements calling the functions initGuard and initOgre.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element
        guardType - initial guard type of the first level
        ogresNumber - number of ogres of the second level

      • initLock

        public void initLock(Elements position)
        Create a new lock of the lever type if is the level 1 or the key type otherwise
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element

      • initGuard

        public void initGuard(Elements position,
                      java.lang.String guardType)
        Create a new guard take in account the type of guard.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element
        guardType - type of guard to be create

      • initDoors

        public void initDoors(Elements position,
                      char[][] tmpMap)
        Create a new door take in account if it is in the map extremes (exit door) or not (normal door).
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element
        tmpMap - game map

      • initOgres

        public void initOgres(Elements position,
                      int ogresNumber)
        Call the findClubPosition to find the club and create a ogresNumber of new ogres.
        Parameters:
        position - coordinates of the element
        ogresNumber - number of ogres to be create

      • findClubPosition

        public Elements findClubPosition(Elements position,
                                 char[][] tmpMap)
        Find the position around the ogre where is the club.
        Parameters:
        position - position of the ogre
        tmpMap - game map
        Returns:
        Return the position of the club.

      • checkGameStatus

        public void checkGameStatus()
        Check the position of the hero and if he is captured or killed by a guard, if it is the first level, or a ogre, if it is the second level. If the hero has been captured, the gameState change to GameOver.

      • updateMap

        public char[][] updateMap(char[][] tmpMap)
        Receive a game map and changes it according to the changes previously made to the components of the game, for example, when the doors is unlocked is need change the mark that echoes the door in the map.
        Parameters:
        tmpMap - game map to be updated
        Returns:
        the updated game map
